canonical_explanation.text: An angle is formed when two rays share a common endpoint called the vertex. Angles are measured in degrees using a protractor. Different types of angles are classified based on their measure. Complementary angles sum to 90°, and supplementary angles sum to 180°.

questions.question_text: An angle is formed by:

options.text: Two rays with a common endpoint

questions.explanation_correct: An angle is formed when two rays (or lines) share a common endpoint called the vertex. This allows the two rays to form an angle that can be measured in degrees using a protractor.
questions.explanation_incorrect: An angle is not formed by two lines, because lines do not have a common endpoint. Parallel lines also cannot form an angle, as they do not intersect. A single ray cannot form an angle on its own, as an angle requires two rays or lines meeting at a point.

questions.question_text: The common endpoint of the two rays forming an angle is called:
questions.explanation_correct: The common endpoint of the two rays forming an angle is called the vertex. This is the point where the two rays meet and the angle is formed.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The vertex is the common endpoint of the two rays that form an angle. It is not one of the arms or sides of the angle, and it is not a corner. The vertex is the special point where the two rays come together to create the angle.

questions.question_text: An angle measuring 75° is called:
questions.explanation_correct: An angle of 75° is called an acute angle because it is less than 90°. Acute angles are smaller than a right angle (90°).
questions.explanation_incorrect: An angle of 75° is not a right angle (90°), an obtuse angle (greater than 90°), or a reflex angle (greater than 180°). It is an acute angle, which is less than 90°. Acute angles are smaller than a right angle.

questions.question_text: Which angle is a right angle?
questions.explanation_correct: A right angle is an angle that measures exactly 90 degrees. This is the angle formed when two lines or rays meet at a perfect square corner. So the correct answer is option B, 90 degrees.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The other options are not right angles. 45 degrees is an acute angle, 120 degrees is an obtuse angle, and 180 degrees is a straight angle. Only 90 degrees is a right angle, which means the lines or rays meet at a perfect square corner.

questions.question_text: An angle measuring 145° is:
questions.explanation_correct: The angle measuring 145° is an obtuse angle. An obtuse angle is an angle that measures more than 90° but less than 180°. Since 145° is between 90° and 180°, it is considered an obtuse angle.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The angle of 145° is not acute, which is an angle less than 90°. It is also not a right angle, which is exactly 90°. The angle of 145° is also not a reflex angle, which is an angle greater than 180°. The correct answer is that the 145° angle is an obtuse angle, which is an angle greater than 90° but less than 180°.

questions.question_text: A straight angle measures:
questions.explanation_correct: A straight angle measures 180 degrees. This is because a straight angle is formed when two rays form a straight line, which is 180 degrees in total.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A straight angle is not 90 degrees, because that would be a right angle. A straight angle is also not 270 degrees or 360 degrees, because those are larger angles that go beyond a straight line. The correct answer is 180 degrees, because a straight angle is formed when two rays form a straight line, which is 180 degrees in total.

questions.question_text: Which instrument is used to measure angles?
questions.explanation_correct: A protractor is used to measure angles. It has a scale that shows the measure of an angle in degrees, so it is the correct tool to use when you want to find the size of an angle.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A ruler is used to measure lengths and distances, not angles. A compass is used to draw circles, not measure angles. A divider is used to transfer measurements, not measure angles. The correct tool to measure angles is a protractor, which has a scale that shows the measure of an angle in degrees.

questions.question_text: When measuring an angle with a protractor, where should the center be placed?

options.text: On one arm of the angle
On the vertex of the angle

questions.explanation_correct: The center of the protractor should be placed on the vertex of the angle because the vertex is the common endpoint of the two rays that form the angle. This allows the protractor to accurately measure the angle between the two rays.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The center of the protractor should not be placed on one arm of the angle, inside the angle, or outside the angle. This would not give an accurate measurement of the angle. The vertex is the correct place to put the center of the protractor because it is the common endpoint of the two rays that form the angle.

questions.question_text: Two angles are complementary if their sum is:
questions.explanation_correct: Two angles are complementary if their sum is 90°. This is because complementary angles add up to a right angle, which is 90°.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The sum of two complementary angles is not 180°, 360°, or 270°. Complementary angles are two angles that add up to 90°, or a right angle. So the correct answer is that their sum is 90°.

questions.question_text: If one angle is 35°, what is its complement?
questions.explanation_correct: The complement of an angle is the angle that, when added to the original angle, equals 90°. If one angle is 35°, then its complement is 90° - 35° = 55°, which is option B.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The complement of an angle is the angle that, when added to the original angle, equals 90°. If one angle is 35°, then its complement is 90° - 35° = 55°, not 45°, 145°, or 325°. The complement is always the angle that, when added to the original angle, sums to 90°.

questions.question_text: The supplement of a 70° angle is ___
questions.explanation_correct: The supplement of an angle is the angle that, when added to the original angle, equals 180 degrees. Since the given angle is 70 degrees, the supplement of 70 degrees is 180 - 70 = 110 degrees.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The supplement of a 70 degree angle is not 110 degrees. The supplement of an angle is the angle that, when added to the original angle, equals 180 degrees. To find the supplement, you need to subtract the given angle from 180 degrees. 180 - 70 = 110 degrees, so the correct answer is 110 degrees.

questions.question_text: A reflex angle is:
questions.explanation_correct: A reflex angle is an angle that measures between 180 and 360 degrees. This is because a reflex angle is greater than a straight angle (180 degrees), but less than a full circle (360 degrees).
questions.explanation_incorrect: A reflex angle is not less than 90 degrees, as that would be an acute angle. It is also not exactly 180 degrees, as that would be a straight angle. A reflex angle is an angle that is between 180 and 360 degrees, which is why option C is the correct answer.

questions.question_text: The angle at the corner of a book is usually:
questions.explanation_correct: The angle at the corner of a book is a right angle because a right angle measures exactly 90 degrees. The two sides of the book's corner meet at a perfect 90-degree angle.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The angle at the corner of a book is not an acute angle, which is less than 90 degrees, or an obtuse angle, which is greater than 90 degrees. It is also not a straight angle, which is 180 degrees. Instead, the angle at the corner of a book is a right angle, which is exactly 90 degrees.

questions.question_text: Two supplementary angles are in the ratio 2:3. Find the larger angle.
questions.explanation_correct: The correct answer is B) 108°. Since the two supplementary angles are in the ratio 2:3, the larger angle must be 3 parts out of the total 5 parts. This means the larger angle is 3/5 of 180°, which is 108°.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect answer is A) 72°. This is not correct because supplementary angles always add up to 180°. If the larger angle is 72°, then the smaller angle would be 108°, which does not match the given ratio of 2:3.

questions.question_text: What type of angle is formed by the hands of a clock at 3 o'clock?
questions.explanation_correct: The hands of a clock at 3 o'clock form a right angle, which is 90 degrees. This is because a right angle is formed when two rays meet at a 90-degree angle, just like the position of the clock hands at 3 o'clock.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The hands of a clock at 3 o'clock do not form an acute angle (less than 90 degrees), an obtuse angle (more than 90 degrees), or a straight angle (180 degrees). The correct angle formed is a right angle, which is exactly 90 degrees. This is because the clock hands are perpendicular to each other at this time.

questions.question_text: The two rays forming an angle are called:
questions.explanation_correct: The two rays forming an angle are called the arms of the angle. The angle is formed where the two rays meet at a common endpoint called the vertex.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The sides of a shape are the line segments that enclose the shape. The vertices are the endpoints where the sides meet. The edges of a shape are the line segments that connect the vertices. In the case of an angle, the two rays that form the angle are called the arms of the angle, not the sides, vertices, or edges.

questions.question_text: An angle can be formed by a single ray.
questions.explanation_correct: An angle is formed when two rays share a common endpoint, called the vertex. So an angle cannot be formed by a single ray alone.
questions.explanation_incorrect: You might think that a single ray can form an angle, but that's not correct. An angle is always formed by two rays meeting at a common point, called the vertex. A single ray alone does not create an angle.

questions.question_text: How many angles are formed when three rays share a common endpoint?
questions.explanation_correct: When three rays share a common endpoint, they form 3 angles. This is because each pair of adjacent rays forms one angle at the common endpoint.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Option C is correct because when three rays share a common endpoint, they form 3 angles. This is because each pair of adjacent rays (for example, the first and second ray, the second and third ray, and the first and third ray) forms one angle at the common endpoint. So, the total number of angles formed is 3.

questions.question_text: An angle that measures exactly 90° is called:
questions.explanation_correct: A right angle measures exactly 90 degrees, so the correct answer is B) Right angle. This is because a right angle is a special type of angle that forms a perfect square corner.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The other options are not correct. An acute angle is less than 90 degrees, an obtuse angle is more than 90 degrees, and a straight angle is 180 degrees. Only a right angle, which measures exactly 90 degrees, is the correct answer.

questions.question_text: An angle measuring between 0° and 90° is called:
questions.explanation_correct: An angle measuring between 0° and 90° is called an acute angle. This is because an acute angle is any angle that is less than 90 degrees, or a right angle.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Option A, 'acute angle', is the correct answer. Acute angles are less than 90 degrees, while right angles are exactly 90 degrees, obtuse angles are greater than 90 degrees, and reflex angles are greater than 180 degrees. So an angle measuring between 0° and 90° must be an acute angle.

questions.question_text: Which of these is an obtuse angle?
questions.explanation_correct: An obtuse angle is an angle that measures more than 90 degrees. Option C, 125 degrees, is an obtuse angle because it is greater than 90 degrees.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Option A, 85 degrees, is an acute angle because it is less than 90 degrees. Option B, 90 degrees, is a right angle because it is exactly 90 degrees. Option D, 180 degrees, is a straight angle because it is 180 degrees. Only option C, 125 degrees, is an obtuse angle.

questions.question_text: An angle measuring 215° is a:
questions.explanation_correct: An angle measuring 215° is a reflex angle. A reflex angle is an angle that is greater than 180° and less than 360°. Since 215° is greater than 180°, it is a reflex angle.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The other options are not correct. A straight angle is 180°, an obtuse angle is between 90° and 180°, and a complete angle is 360°. Since 215° is greater than 180°, it cannot be a straight angle or an obtuse angle. And 215° is not a complete angle either, which is 360°. Therefore, the correct answer is a reflex angle.

questions.question_text: A complete angle measures ___ degrees.
questions.explanation_correct: A complete angle measures 360 degrees because a full circle is made up of 360 degrees. Angles are measured in degrees using a protractor, and a full circle around a point (or vertex) is equal to 360 degrees.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is 360 degrees. An angle is formed when two rays share a common endpoint called the vertex. A full circle or complete angle around a point is 360 degrees. This is because a protractor, the tool used to measure angles, is divided into 360 degrees. So a complete angle, going all the way around a point, must be 360 degrees.

questions.question_text: An angle of 89° is an acute angle.
questions.explanation_correct: An angle of 89° is an acute angle because it is less than 90°. Acute angles measure between 0° and 90°.
questions.explanation_incorrect: An angle of 89° is not an obtuse angle. Obtuse angles are greater than 90°. An angle of 89° is less than 90° and is therefore an acute angle.

questions.question_text: An angle of 91° is a right angle.
questions.explanation_correct: An angle of 91 degrees is not a right angle. A right angle is exactly 90 degrees, so an angle of 91 degrees is larger than a right angle.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A right angle is an angle that measures exactly 90 degrees. Since 91 degrees is more than 90 degrees, it is not a right angle. A right angle is a special type of angle where the two rays form a perfect square corner.

questions.question_text: Angles are measured in:
questions.explanation_correct: Angles are measured in degrees using a protractor. This is because degrees are the standard unit used to measure the size or measure of an angle.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Angles are not measured in centimeters, meters, or grams. These are units used to measure length, distance, or weight, not the size of an angle. Angles are specifically measured in degrees using a special tool called a protractor.

questions.question_text: While using a protractor, the baseline should be placed:

options.text: Parallel to one arm of the angle
Along one arm of the angle

questions.explanation_correct: The baseline of the protractor should be placed along one arm of the angle you want to measure. This aligns the protractor with the angle, allowing you to read the angle's measure directly from the protractor.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The baseline of the protractor should not be placed parallel to or perpendicular to the angle. This would not align the protractor properly with the angle, making it difficult to read the angle's measure. The baseline should be placed directly along one of the arms of the angle for an accurate reading.

questions.question_text: A protractor has markings from 0° to 180°.
questions.explanation_correct: A protractor has markings from 0° to 180° because an angle can measure up to 180 degrees. This is because the two rays of an angle form a straight line, and a straight line has a measurement of 180 degrees.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A protractor does not have markings from 0° to 360°. That would be for measuring a full circle, which is 360 degrees. Angles are measured using a protractor, and the protractor has markings from 0° to 180° because an angle can measure up to 180 degrees, which is half of a full circle.

questions.question_text: Two angles are supplementary if their sum is:
questions.explanation_correct: Two angles are supplementary if their sum is 180°. This is because supplementary angles add up to a straight line, which measures 180°.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Angles that add up to 90° are called complementary angles, not supplementary angles. Supplementary angles are angles that add up to 180°. This means that the correct answer is option B, where the sum of the two angles is 180°.

questions.question_text: What is the complement of a 45° angle?
questions.explanation_correct: The complement of a 45° angle is 45°. This is because complementary angles add up to 90°, and 45° + 45° = 90°.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is A) 45°. This is because complementary angles add up to 90°. So, if one angle is 45°, then its complement, or the other angle, must also be 45°. The other options are incorrect because 135° is not a complement, 55° is not a complement, and 90° is not the complement of 45°.

questions.question_text: The complement of a 28° angle is ___
questions.explanation_correct: The complement of a 28° angle is 62° because the sum of two complementary angles is always 90°. So if one angle is 28°, the other must be 90° - 28° = 62°.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The accepted answer format is a number with the degree symbol (°). The complement of a 28° angle is not 28°, because complementary angles always add up to 90°. To find the complement, we subtract 28° from 90°, which gives us 62°.

questions.question_text: What is the supplement of a 135° angle?
questions.explanation_correct: The supplement of a 135° angle is 45°. This is because the sum of the measures of a pair of supplementary angles is always 180°. So, 135° + 45° = 180°.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The supplement of a 135° angle is not 55° or 35°. The supplement of an angle is the angle that, when added to the original angle, gives a total of 180°. In this case, the supplement of 135° is 45°, not 55° or 35°.

questions.question_text: Two angles of 50° and 40° are complementary.
questions.explanation_correct: The two angles of 50° and 40° are complementary because their sum is 90°. Complementary angles always add up to 90°.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The two angles of 50° and 40° are not supplementary, which means they don't add up to 180°. Supplementary angles have a sum of 180°. Instead, these two angles are complementary because their sum is 90°.

questions.question_text: Two angles of 100° and 90° are supplementary.
questions.explanation_correct: Two angles of 100° and 90° are not supplementary because supplementary angles add up to 180°. The sum of 100° and 90° is 190°, which is not 180°.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Supplementary angles are two angles that add up to 180°. The two angles given, 100° and 90°, do not add up to 180°. Therefore, they are not supplementary angles.

questions.question_text: What type of angle is formed by the hands of a clock at 6 o'clock?
questions.explanation_correct: The hands of a clock at 6 o'clock form a straight angle. A straight angle is 180 degrees, which means the two rays that form the angle are in a straight line, pointing in opposite directions.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is D) Straight angle. This is because the hands of a clock at 6 o'clock form an angle of 180 degrees, which is a straight angle. Acute angles are less than 90 degrees, right angles are exactly 90 degrees, and obtuse angles are greater than 90 degrees but less than 180 degrees.

questions.question_text: What type of angle is formed between the hands of a clock at 5 o'clock?
questions.explanation_correct: The angle formed between the hands of a clock at 5 o'clock is an obtuse angle, which means it is greater than 90 degrees. This is because the hour hand is pointing to 5, and the minute hand is pointing somewhere between 12 and 1, creating an angle larger than a right angle (90 degrees).
questions.explanation_incorrect: The angle formed between the clock hands at 5 o'clock is not an acute angle (less than 90 degrees) or a right angle (exactly 90 degrees). It is also not a straight angle (180 degrees). Instead, it is an obtuse angle, which is greater than 90 degrees but less than 180 degrees. This is because the hour hand is pointing to 5, and the minute hand is somewhere between 12 and 1, creating an angle larger than a right angle.

questions.question_text: If two complementary angles are in the ratio 1:4, find the smaller angle.
questions.explanation_correct: The smaller angle is 18° because complementary angles sum to 90°, and if the ratio of the two angles is 1:4, then the smaller angle must be 1/5 of 90°, which is 18°.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The smaller angle is not 72°. If the two complementary angles are in the ratio 1:4, the smaller angle must be 1/5 of 90°, which is 18°. The other option, 22.5°, is incorrect because the smaller angle should be a whole number of degrees.

questions.question_text: Two supplementary angles differ by 40°. Find the larger angle.
questions.explanation_correct: The larger angle is 110° because the two supplementary angles differ by 40°. Supplementary angles add up to 180°, so the larger angle must be 140° (180° - 40°).
questions.explanation_incorrect: The larger angle is 110°, not 70°. This is because supplementary angles add up to 180°. If the two angles differ by 40°, then the larger angle must be 140° (180° - 40°).

questions.question_text: How many degrees does the minute hand of a clock move in 15 minutes?
questions.explanation_correct: The minute hand of a clock moves 90° in 15 minutes because the minute hand covers one-quarter of the clock face, which is 90°, in 15 minutes. This is because the full rotation of the minute hand (360°) takes 60 minutes, so in 15 minutes it covers 1/4 of that distance.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The minute hand does not move 15° in 15 minutes, as that would be 1° per minute, which is not correct. It also does not move 45° or 180° in 15 minutes. The minute hand moves 90° in 15 minutes because it covers 1/4 of the clock face, which is 90 degrees, in that time period.

questions.question_text: In angle ABC, which letter represents the vertex?
questions.explanation_correct: The vertex of an angle is the point where the two rays meet. In the angle ABC, the letter B represents the vertex, since it is the common endpoint of the two rays that form the angle.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The vertex of an angle is the common endpoint of the two rays that form the angle. In the angle ABC, the letter B represents the vertex, not A or C. This is because B is the point where the two rays that form the angle ABC meet.

questions.question_text: If an angle is 30° more than its complement, find the angle.
questions.explanation_correct: The correct answer is 60°. If the angle is 30° more than its complement, then the complement of the angle is 30°. The sum of an angle and its complement is always 90°. So, the angle must be 60°.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect answer is 75°. The complement of an angle is 90° minus the angle. If the angle is 30° more than its complement, then the complement is 30°. The sum of the angle and its complement is 90°, so the angle must be 60°, not 75°.

questions.question_text: Find the angle which is equal to its own supplement.
questions.explanation_correct: The angle that is equal to its own supplement is 90°. This is because the supplement of an angle is the angle that, when added to the original angle, equals 180°. If an angle is equal to its own supplement, then it must be 90°, since 90° + 90° = 180°.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The angle that is equal to its own supplement is 90°, not 45°, 60°, or 180°. This is because the supplement of an angle is the angle that, when added to the original angle, equals 180°. If an angle is equal to its own supplement, then it must be 90°, since 90° + 90° = 180°.

questions.question_text: Find the angle which is equal to its own complement.
questions.explanation_correct: The angle that is equal to its own complement is 45°. This is because the complement of an angle is the angle that, when added to the original angle, equals 90°. If the original angle is 45°, then its complement is also 45°, since 45° + 45° = 90°.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Option B, 45°, is the correct answer because the complement of an angle is the angle that, when added to the original angle, equals 90°. So, if an angle is equal to its own complement, it must be 45°, since 45° + 45° = 90°. The other options, 30°, 60°, and 90°, are not equal to their own complement.

questions.question_text: To measure an angle greater than 180°, you should:

options.text: Measure the smaller angle and subtract from 360°

questions.explanation_correct: To measure an angle greater than 180°, you should measure the smaller angle and subtract it from 360°. This is because angles greater than 180° are called reflex angles, and they can be measured by finding the smaller angle and subtracting it from the full circle of 360°.
questions.explanation_incorrect: You cannot measure an angle greater than 180° directly using a protractor, as a protractor only measures up to 180°. Measuring two protractors at the same time would not work, as it would be difficult to align them accurately. The correct way is to measure the smaller angle and subtract it from 360° to find the reflex angle.

questions.question_text: A zero angle measures:
questions.explanation_correct: A zero angle measures 0 degrees because it means the two rays are pointing in the same direction and do not form an angle at all.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is A) 0 degrees. An angle is the space between two rays that share a common endpoint. When the two rays are pointing in the same direction, there is no angle formed, so the angle measurement is 0 degrees. Options B) 90 degrees, C) 180 degrees, and D) 360 degrees all describe different types of angles, but they are not correct for a zero angle.

questions.question_text: The supplement of an angle is 4 times its complement. Find the angle.
questions.explanation_correct: The correct answer is C) 60°. This is because the supplement of an angle is the angle that, when added to the original angle, equals 180°. If the supplement is 4 times the complement (the angle that, when added to the original angle, equals 90°), then the original angle must be 60°.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect answers are A) 30°, B) 45°, and D) 75°. These are not the correct angle because the supplement of an angle is 4 times its complement, which means the original angle must be 60°. The supplement of 60° is 120°, and the complement of 60° is 30°, which is one-fourth of 120°.

questions.question_text: At what time between 2 and 3 o'clock will the hands of a clock be at right angles?
questions.explanation_correct: The hands of the clock are at right angles (90 degrees) when the hour hand is exactly halfway between 2 and 3 o'clock, which is around 2:27.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Option A (2:27) is correct because when the hour hand is exactly halfway between 2 and 3 o'clock, the minute hand is at 6 o'clock. This means the two hands form a 90 degree angle, which is a right angle. The other options do not show the hands at a right angle.

questions.question_text: The symbol used to denote an angle is ___
questions.explanation_correct: The symbol used to denote an angle is ∠ because it looks like an 'open corner' and represents the space between the two rays that form the angle.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct symbol to denote an angle is ∠. This symbol looks like an 'open corner' and is used to represent the space between the two rays that form the angle. Some students may think the symbol is a letter 'L' or a plus sign (+), but these are not the correct symbols for angles.

questions.question_text: Two complementary angles are such that one is twice the other. Find the angles.
questions.explanation_correct: The correct answer is B) 30° and 60°. This is because complementary angles add up to 90°, and one angle is twice the other. So if one angle is 30°, the other must be 60° to add up to 90°.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The other options are incorrect because they do not satisfy the condition that the two complementary angles add up to 90° and one is twice the other. For option A, 20° and 40° do not add up to 90°. For option C, 45° and 90° are not complementary angles. For option D, 25° and 50° do not have a 2:1 ratio.

questions.question_text: What unit is used for 55°?
questions.explanation_correct: The angle of 55° is an acute angle. Acute angles are angles that measure less than 90°, and 55° is less than 90°, so it is an acute angle.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The angle of 55° is not an obtuse angle, reflex angle, or right angle. Obtuse angles are greater than 90°, reflex angles are greater than 180°, and right angles are exactly 90°. Since 55° is less than 90°, it is an acute angle.

questions.question_text: What unit is used for 90°?
questions.explanation_correct: The unit used for 90° is a right angle. A right angle is a special type of angle that measures exactly 90°. This means the two rays that form the angle are perpendicular to each other.
questions.explanation_incorrect: An obtuse angle is greater than 90°, a reflex angle is greater than 180°, and an acute angle is less than 90°. None of these options are the correct unit for measuring a 90° angle. The right angle, which measures exactly 90°, is the appropriate unit to use in this case.

questions.question_text: What unit is used for 165°?
questions.explanation_correct: The answer is D) Obtuse angle. An obtuse angle is an angle that measures between 90° and 180°, and 165° falls within this range. Therefore, the unit used for 165° is an obtuse angle.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is an obtuse angle. A reflex angle is an angle that measures between 180° and 360°, which is not the case for 165°. A right angle is exactly 90°, and an acute angle is less than 90°, so neither of these options are correct for 165°.

questions.question_text: What unit is used for 270°?
questions.explanation_correct: A reflex angle is an angle that is greater than 180 degrees. Since 270 degrees is greater than 180 degrees, it is a reflex angle.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A right angle is 90 degrees, an acute angle is less than 90 degrees, and an obtuse angle is greater than 90 degrees but less than 180 degrees. 270 degrees is greater than 180 degrees, so it is not any of these types of angles. It is a reflex angle, which is an angle greater than 180 degrees.
